sentence.Network_en: Up to now the post of president has been largely ceremonial.
sentence.Network_cn: 到目前为止，总统一职在很大程度上只是礼仪性的。

sentence.Network_en: Feathers of various kinds are used by Native Americans for ceremonial purposes.
sentence.Network_cn: 美洲印第安人在举行仪式时用到各种羽毛。

sentence.Network_en: The visit was conducted with all due ceremonial.
sentence.Network_cn: 访问按照一切应有的礼仪进行。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin caerimonialis, from caerimonia 'religious worship' (see ceremony)

entry.def: Something that is ceremonial relates to a ceremony or is used in a ceremony.

example.ex: He represented the nation on ceremonial occasions...
example.tran: 他在正式场合代表国家。

example.ex: Feathers of various kinds are used by Native Americans for ceremonial purposes.
example.tran: 美洲印第安人在举行仪式时用到各种羽毛。

entry.tran: (职位、功能或事件)礼仪性的，象征性的
entry.def: A position, function, or event that is ceremonial is considered to be representative of an institution, but has very little authority or influence.

example.ex: Up to now the post of president has been largely ceremonial.
example.tran: 到目前为止，总统一职在很大程度上只是礼仪性的。

entry.def: Ceremonial consists of all the impressive things that are done, said, and worn on very formal occasions.

example.ex: ...the ceremonials leading up to the young Emperor's wedding.
example.tran: 年轻皇帝大婚前的典礼

means.word_mean: 1. a formal event performed on a special occasion;
1. marked by pomp or ceremony or formality;

auth_sentence.content: It will be a ceremonial funeral with military honors.
auth_sentence.res_content: It will be a ceremonial funeral with military honors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It will be a ceremonial funeral with military honors.

auth_sentence.content: She was accorded a ceremonial funeral with military honours.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was accorded a ceremonial funeral with military honours.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was accorded a ceremonial funeral with military honours.

auth_sentence.content: The role of the president is largely ceremonial.
auth_sentence.res_content: The role of the president is largely ceremonial.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The role of the president is largely ceremonial.

sentences.en: He is arrayed in ceremonial robes.
The ceremonial opening of the exhibition was very spectacular.
sentences.cn: 展览会的开幕式非常壮观。

sentences.en: The monarch’s role is purely ceremonial.
sentences.cn: 君主纯粹是个礼仪职位。
